channel.title: Julia on Josh Duncan
channel.description: Recent content in Julia on Josh Duncan

item.title: Kernel Density Estimation from Scratch
item.description: KDE with KernelDensity.jl From the Kernel Density Estimation Wikipedia site we can take a look at reproducing the Example section. using StatsPlots x = [-2.1; -1.3; -0.4; 1.9; 5.1; 6.2]; scatter(x, zeros(length(x)), legend = false) KDE Now applying the quick and easy solution: a package. import KernelDensity KernelDensity.kde(x, bandwidth = sqrt(2.25)) |> x -> plot!(x, legend = false) KDE with Distributions.jl Creating individual distributions for each data point.
